tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished 151-200 on 2014-15 PGA TOUR FedExCup Points List
tourBios.carHigh:
Played on the PGA TOUR Canada from 2010 to 2012, winning the 2011 Western Championship.

2013: Made the cut in five of 18 Web.com Tour starts during his rookie season...Poor open to his season resulted in 11 missed cuts in his first 13 starts, the only bright moment being a T15 in the Tour's second tournament, in Colombia...Had a nice two-week stretch in July, finishing T7 at the Utah Championship and then coming back a week later to improve that by one spot with a T6 effort at the Midwest Classic near Kansas City to rise to 69th in earnings...At the Utah Championship, enjoyed a front-nine 29 (six birdies, three pars) on his way to a 65 at Willow Creek CC...Two missed cuts and a T45 in his last three starts to end the Regular Season dropped him to 87th in earnings.

2012: Monday qualifier at the Mylan Classic, where he finished T47 in his first career Web.com Tour start. 2011: Missed the cut at the RBC Canadian Open after receiving a sponsor exemption into the event.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a provincial individual champion in golf at Merritt Secondary School in British Columbia...Was a second-team All-Conference USA selection.
tourBios.personal: Favorite golf memory was shooting a 58 and losing money to his dad...If he didn't play golf, says he would be playing in the NHL...Favorite Web site is stumbleupon.com...Twitter account is @rogersloan87...Always carries Gatorade G2 in his golf bag.
tourBios.priorYearSeason: Rookie season on the PGA TOUR included seven made cuts in 20 starts and a final ranking of No. 200 in the FedExCup standings. Opened with a 70 at the John Deere Classic and then closed with three rounds in the 60s (68-67-67) to finish a season-best T18...Had an ace on the par-3 fourth hole during the first round of the Sanderson Farms Championship but with rounds of 74-75 missed the cut...In the Web.com Tour Finals, opened with a T58 at the Hotel Fitness Championship. Missed the cut in the next three. Finished 98th on the Finals' money list.

tourBios.carHigh:
Played on the PGA TOUR Canada from 2010 to 2012.



2014-15: Rookie season on the PGA TOUR included seven made cuts in 20 starts and a final ranking of No. 200 in the FedExCup standings. Opened with a 70 at the John Deere Classic and then closed with three rounds in the 60s (68-67-67) to finish a season-best T18...Had an ace on the par-3 fourth hole during the first round of the Sanderson Farms Championship but with rounds of 74-75 missed the cut...In the Web.com Tour Finals, opened with a T58 at the Hotel Fitness Championship. Missed the cut in the next three. Finished 98th on the Finals' money list.

2013-14: Finished the year playing in 15 Web.com Tour events, a season that included one win, five top-25s and eight cuts made...Best results in the first half of the campaign came in back-to-back weeks in May, at the South Georgia Classic (T14) and BMW Charity Pro-Am (T18)...Recorded a hole-in-one on the 11th hole in the first round of the Chile Classic, his first in competition. Finished with a 6-under 66...In July, recorded his first top-10 of the year, winning for the first time on the Web.com Tour in his native Canada, in his 32nd start. Captured the inaugural Nova Scotia Open in Halifax, sending the homeland fans into a spontaneous rendition of the Canadian national anthem after the last putt dropped. An 8-foot par putt on the 72nd hole sent the tournament into overtime. Claimed the victory on the first extra hole, sinking a 4Â˝ footer for par to outlast Derek Fathauer, who bogeyed two of the last three holes of regulation as well as the extra hole. Opened with rounds of 67-65. Saturday's play was wiped out when Tropical Storm Arthur blew through the province, accompanied by 40-60 mph wind. 36 holes were played Sunday, for the first time on Tour since 2005. Became the second Canadian to win in 2014 (Adam Hadwin) and third to claim victory on his home soil (Richard Zokol, David Hearn). It was his first win since the PGA TOUR Canada's 2011 event in Kamloops, B.C. Moved to 12th on the money list...Officially secured his 2014-15 PGA TOUR card for the first time at the conclusion of the Regular Season in Portland in late-August (24th on the money list)...Made the cut in the second and third of the four Finals' events (T41 and T32).

2013: Made the cut in five of 18 Web.com Tour starts during his rookie season...Poor open to his season resulted in 11 missed cuts in his first 13 starts, the only bright moment being a T15 in the Tour's second tournament, in Colombia...Had a nice two-week stretch in July, finishing T7 at the Utah Championship and then coming back a week later to improve that by one spot with a T6 effort at the Midwest Classic near Kansas City to rise to 69th in earnings...At the Utah Championship, enjoyed a front-nine 29 (six birdies, three pars) on his way to a 65 at Willow Creek CC...Two missed cuts and a T45 in his last three starts to end the Regular Season dropped him to 87th in earnings.

2012: Monday qualifier at the Mylan Classic, where he finished T47 in his first career Web.com Tour start. 2011: Missed the cut at the RBC Canadian Open after receiving a sponsor exemption into the event.

Amateur: Was a provincial individual champion in golf at Merritt Secondary School in British Columbia...Was a second-team All-Conference USA selection.
tourBios.personal: Favorite golf memory was shooting a 58 and losing money to his dad...If he didn't play golf, says he would be playing in the NHL...Favorite website is stumbleupon.com...Twitter account is @rogersloan87...Always carries Gatorade G2 in his golf bag.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T18th in 2015 at the John Deere Classic.
